intro: Crepinella clavigera, commonly known as the scarlet gourd, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant produces striking orange to red fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are hairy and trailing. The flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female blooms, a characteristic common in many members of the gourd family.
